page.title: 16THE KNIGHTS OF ST. JOHN
page.content: The name Knightsridge comes from its association with the Knights of St. John. These Knights began as a religious order of the Roman Catholic Church and were founded in the 11th century by a man named Gerard. They were based in a monastery in Jerusalem. The Order came to Scotland in the 12th century and built a priory at Torphichen, near Bathgate. This priory was dedicated to John the Baptist and they were called the brothers of St.John. At first their work was limited to caring for pilgrims and the sick. Later the Order fought in the crusades and took the name, Knights of St. John. These knights owned a stretch of land from Torphichen to the present-day Howden area of Livingston where Knightsridge now stands. .
